text: Hello, my name is Jonathan Samir Matthis and I am a professor of neuroscience in Boston, Massachusetts, USA. Now it's a rather long story, but these days I spend most of my time building free open source software based on technologies that I am familiar with as a result of my scientific research. And this is one of them. So what you should be seeing is a transcription of the words that I am saying in English and then the translation of those words into several other languages below. And if you pause the video at any point in time, it should be highlighting the word that I am currently saying in English and then the closest matching word in the translations below. Let's give that a quick test. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. Red, blue, green, yellow, pink. My dad is from Texas, my mom is from Syria, my brother is named Paul, and I have two cats named Poo and Ollie. Which way is the library? Okay, thank you, nice to meet you. So that's the basic idea. If you speak any of these languages, please let me know how it goes, especially in the word highlight matching thing. And if you're interested in this project, I would love to develop it, so let me know. Thank you.
